seo.title: About
seo.description: A hands-on gardener who cares about the finish. I keep things simple: show up on time, do the work properly, and leave your outdoor space looking sharper than when I arrived.

hero.headline: A hands-on gardener who cares about the finish.
hero.subheading: I keep things simple: show up on time, do the work properly, and leave your outdoor space looking sharper than when I arrived.

features.text: on tidy edges, clean lines, and a proper finish.
so you know what’s happening and when.
that look good and stay manageable.
— clean up is part of the job.

hero.footnote: Prefer a quick message? The quote form works best.

story.title: Clean, calm, and maintained — not just “done”.
paragraphs: Good gardening is the small stuff done consistently: edges that stay sharp, beds that don’t creep, lawns cut the right way, and clean-ups that actually feel like a reset.
Whether it’s ongoing maintenance or a one-off transformation, the goal is the same — leave you with an outdoor space you’re proud of.

highlights.title: Practical choices
highlights.description: Designs and maintenance plans that suit your time, budget, and yard.

highlights.title: Strong finish
highlights.description: Tidy-up isn’t optional — it’s the last 10% that makes it look 100%.

highlights.title: Reliable routine
highlights.description: Clear comms, consistent quality, and no surprises.

items.text: — what we’re doing, what we’re not, and what matters most.
— paths cleared, clippings handled, and a clean finish.
— maintained edges, controlled growth, and less mess over time.
— gates, access, pets, and neighbours considered.

goal.title: The goal
goal.description: Leave you with a garden that looks better now — and is easier to keep looking good.

timeline.title: Built step-by-step — quality first.
timeline.description: A quick snapshot of how the work evolved: from basic maintenance to a clean, consistent standard across every job.

items.title: Started with the basics
items.description: Simple maintenance jobs, cleanups, and learning what makes a garden actually stay tidy week to week.

items.title: Dialled in a ‘clean finish’ standard
items.description: Edges, blow-down, and leaving things neat became non-negotiable — the final 10% that people notice.

items.title: Bigger yards + better systems
items.description: Built repeatable routines for lawns, pruning, and weeding so the quality stays consistent.

items.title: More landscaping-style work
items.description: Refreshes, reshapes, and smarter layouts — practical upgrades that make the space feel new.

items.title: Today
items.description: Reliable maintenance, one-off transformations, and honest advice — with a focus on calm, clean outdoor spaces.

process.title: A simple process that keeps standards high.
process.description: No overcomplication. Just clear expectations, reliable delivery, and a finish you’ll notice.

steps.title: Quick scope
steps.description: A short chat and (if needed) a couple of photos so we understand the job and your priorities.

steps.title: Clear plan
steps.description: We agree on what’s included, what matters most, and how we’ll leave the space at the end.

steps.title: Quality work
steps.description: Careful, consistent work — with an eye for the details that make it look sharp.

steps.title: Clean finish
steps.description: Paths cleared, beds tidied, and the final blow-down so it looks properly finished.

items.question: Do you only do ongoing maintenance?
items.answer: No — I do both ongoing garden maintenance and one-off cleanups/refreshes. We’ll figure out what makes sense for your space.

items.question: Can I get a quote without an inspection?
items.answer: Often, yes. A short description and a few photos is usually enough for an initial quote. If anything’s unclear, I’ll ask follow-up questions.

items.question: What areas do you cover?
items.answer: I work locally and can confirm availability quickly once you send your suburb/address.

items.question: Do you take away green waste?
items.answer: Green waste handling depends on the job and your preference. We can discuss options when confirming scope.

items.question: How do I book?
items.answer: Use the quote form or contact page. I’ll confirm timing, scope, and next steps.
